poem:
**Against the Flickering Screen**  

In the still rooms of morning,  
the distant echoes of laughter—  
pictures leaping over celluloid.  
Here, the silence speaks,  
tales untold by shadow's light.  
Yet, behind closed eyes,  
a reel of memory spins:  
fields, not screens, the feelgood  
woven in the shivering grass.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. In our series, My feelgood movie, Guardian writers reflect on their go-to flick, and explain why their pick is endlessly rewatchable. This list will be updated weekly with further picks. Want more options? Here is our earlier list of the 10 best". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
